content: The power of agglomeration Sandra Upson The power of an ecosystem tied to a particular location is no myth. When you look across industries it’s even clearer: Hollywood (Film), New York & London (Finance). In the old days manufacturing towns were just an obvious assumption, and despite the communication gains of the internet, we’re still closer to a locationally fueled economy than the complete alternative. I think Google is very smart for pushing new international hubs. They will subsequently benefit from diversifying their own exposure to growing western political risks and new hyper growth opportunities in developing nations.
